00027 #include "MEM_guardedalloc.h"
00028 
00029 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"
00030 
00031 #include "bmesh.h"
00032 
00033 #include "intern/bmesh_operators_private.h" /* own include */
00034 
00035 enum {
00036     EDGE_SEAM  = 1
00037 };
00038 
00039 enum {
00040     VERT_SEAM  = 2
00041 };
00042 
00049 static void bm_edgesplit_validate_seams(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00050 {
00051     BMOIter siter;
00052     BMIter iter;
00053     BMEdge *e;
00054 
00055     unsigned char *vtouch;
00056     unsigned char *vt;
00057 
00058     BM_mesh_elem_index_ensure(bm, BM_VERT);
00059 
00060     vtouch = MEM_callocN(sizeof(char) * bm->totvert, __func__);
00061 
00062     /* tag all boundary verts so as not to untag an edge which is inbetween only 2 faces [] */
00063     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00064 
00065         /* unrelated to flag assignment in this function - since this is the
00066          * only place we loop over all edges, disable tag */
00067         BM_elem_flag_disable(e, BM_ELEM_INTERNAL_TAG);
00068 
00069         if (e->l == NULL) {
00070             BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, e, EDGE_SEAM);
00071         }
00072         else if (BM_edge_is_boundary(e)) {
00073             vt = &vtouch[BM_elem_index_get(e->v1)]; if (*vt < 2) (*vt)++;
00074             vt = &vtouch[BM_elem_index_get(e->v2)]; if (*vt < 2) (*vt)++;
00075 
00076             /* while the boundary verts need to be tagged,
00077              * the edge its self can't be split */
00078             BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, e, EDGE_SEAM);
00079         }
00080     }
00081 
00082     /* single marked edges unconnected to any other marked edges
00083      * are illegal, go through and unmark them */
00084     BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00085         /* lame, but we don't want the count to exceed 255,
00086          * so just count to 2, its all we need */
00087         unsigned char *vt;
00088         vt = &vtouch[BM_elem_index_get(e->v1)]; if (*vt < 2) (*vt)++;
00089         vt = &vtouch[BM_elem_index_get(e->v2)]; if (*vt < 2) (*vt)++;
00090     }
00091     BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00092         if (vtouch[BM_elem_index_get(e->v1)] == 1 &&
00093             vtouch[BM_elem_index_get(e->v2)] == 1)
00094         {
00095             BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, e, EDGE_SEAM);
00096         }
00097     }
00098 
00099     MEM_freeN(vtouch);
00100 }
00101 
00102 /* keep this operator fast, its used in a modifier */
00103 void bmo_edgesplit_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00104 {
00105     BMOIter siter;
00106     BMEdge *e;
00107     const int use_verts = BMO_slot_bool_get(op, "use_verts");
00108 
00109     BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE, EDGE_SEAM);
00110 
00111     if (use_verts) {
00112         /* this slows down the operation but its ok because the modifier doesn't use */
00113         BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "verts", BM_VERT, VERT_SEAM);
00114 
00115         /* prevent one edge having both verts unflagged
00116          * we could alternately disable these edges, either way its a corner case.
00117          *
00118          * This is needed so we don't split off the edge but then none of its verts which
00119          * would leave a duplicate edge.
00120          */
00121         BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00122             if (UNLIKELY((BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v1, VERT_SEAM) == FALSE &&
00123                           (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v2, VERT_SEAM) == FALSE))))
00124             {
00125                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e->v1, VERT_SEAM);
00126                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e->v2, VERT_SEAM);
00127             }
00128         }
00129     }
00130 
00131     bm_edgesplit_validate_seams(bm, op);
00132 
00133     BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00134         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, EDGE_SEAM)) {
00135             /* this flag gets copied so we can be sure duplicate edges get it too (important) */
00136             BM_elem_flag_enable(e, BM_ELEM_INTERNAL_TAG);
00137 
00138             /* keep splitting until each loop has its own edge */
00139             do {
00140                 bmesh_edge_separate(bm, e, e->l);
00141             } while (!BM_edge_is_boundary(e));
00142 
00143             BM_elem_flag_enable(e->v1, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00144             BM_elem_flag_enable(e->v2, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00145         }
00146     }
00147 
00148     if (use_verts) {
00149         BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00150             if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v1, VERT_SEAM) == FALSE) {
00151                 BM_elem_flag_disable(e->v1, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00152             }
00153             if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v2, VERT_SEAM) == FALSE) {
00154                 BM_elem_flag_disable(e->v2, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00155             }
00156         }
00157     }
00158 
00159     BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00160         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, EDGE_SEAM)) {
00161             if (BM_elem_flag_test(e->v1, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00162                 BM_elem_flag_disable(e->v1, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00163                 bmesh_vert_separate(bm, e->v1, NULL, NULL);
00164             }
00165             if (BM_elem_flag_test(e->v2, BM_ELEM_TAG)) {
00166                 BM_elem_flag_disable(e->v2, BM_ELEM_TAG);
00167                 bmesh_vert_separate(bm, e->v2, NULL, NULL);
00168             }
00169         }
00170     }
00171 
00172     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_hflag(bm, op, "edgeout", BM_EDGE, BM_ELEM_INTERNAL_TAG);
00173 }
